page.title: 02UPMINSTER: INTRODUCTION 2
page.content: Upminster is a{dormitory town}as it is on the edge of London, part of the {Borough of Havering.}The station is usually very busy & congested in the morning & evening{rush hours.}It is used by commuters living locally & going to work in London. In a survey { {4,500}people were estimated to use the station daily. London Transport Underground trains run along the District Line, for which Upminster is the eastern terminal. Britsh Rail trains run to Fenchurch St Station in London & to Laindon, Basidon, & Southend in the east, as well as the unique 'Push & Pull' diesel car service between Upminster & Romford. The area is predominantly a well-to-do middle-class residential area & returned a Conservative M.P. to Parliament in 1984.
